meanings.definition: To command or urge solemnly or earnestly
meanings.sent1: I adjure you to listen carefully to my instructions.
meanings.sent2: The judge will adjure the witness to tell the truth in court.
meanings.sent3: Please adjure the sleepy cat to wake up and play with you.
meanings.sent4: The teacher adjured the students to strive for excellence in their studies.
meanings.sent5: The coach adjured the team to give their all in the final game of the season.

meanings.definition: To appeal to or entreat earnestly
meanings.sent1: I adjure you to help me find my lost puppy.
meanings.sent2: She will adjure her friends to support her during the difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The child adjured the toy to come to life and play with him.
meanings.sent4: The farmer adjured the rain to come and water his crops.
meanings.sent5: The singer adjured the audience to sing along with her during the concert.
